text: it's the holidays which means you'll
probably be eating and making a lot of
cookies and the question that we ask
ourselves every year is how do we make
this year different these lavender
shortbread wreaths are special and
pretty different in a couple ways and
the fun part is that you can actually
decorate them however you want the list
is literally endless all right so let's
get started
so the first thing we do before we even
make the dough is we're going to make
the glaze so we have our bowl of
powdered sugar pretty basic and into it
we're going to add a little bit of cream
of tartar so I'm going to crack my eggs
we're gonna have three egg whites that
go inside
ideally you're going to want to let this
rest at least 12 hours which means make
this today before you plan on decorating
but you know give it a couple hours and
you should be okay I'm gonna whisk the
dry ingredients together before I do
anything else so I'm gonna sugar and my
butter I'm gonna beat this for a couple
minutes just to make sure that it's like
fluffy well aerated oops I almost forgot
you have the lavender the butter and not
the dry because a lavender is better
infused in fat so as you cream it it
sort of perfumes the entire butter so
you're gonna cream your butter and sugar
until it's very pale light fluffy about
five minutes
okay that's ready this is the type of
dough that you could make a month ahead
if you wanted or two hours ahead which
is how long it needs to chill at least
and when I'm patting dough that I'm
going to roll out I always try and make
it as flat as possible in the beginning
okay
so I'm gonna go chill that
so our dough is chilled we're going to
roll out on parchment because it becomes
easier to cut out shapes flour both
sides so now we're going to start
rolling and you want to put a piece of
parchment on top of the flour dough just
to make it much easier periodically it's
nice she lifts up your parchment dust a
little bit more so now I'm going to cut
out my shapes and because we're making
wreaths we need the large outside cutter
and also the cute little tiny inside
cutter and like you're punching out any
sort of shape you want to come as close
together as possible so now I'm going to
gather up most of the scraps so I've got
most of the scraps kind of cleaned up
and now I'm going to go around and cut
out my tiny piece we're gonna roll them
so we can make more Reed's you just want
to give them a little breathing room
because they might puff slightly but you
can put quite a few on the sheet tray at
the same time this is our favorite time
our cookies are cooled we have all of
our decorations we have our glaze that
we made yesterday it's time to decorate
freeze-dried fruits we've got
blueberries raspberries cranberries
dried flowers candied rose petals and
violet and mint chopped pistachios and
some sugared rosemary leaves we are
going to now decorate our cookies which
is basically as easy as taking your cool
cookies dipping them face down into your
glaze and if it's a little lumpy at
first it's fine it's gonna smooth itself
out and you know you can really do
whatever you want which is kind of fun
when I said you could put anything on
that you want and within reason and you
want to do things that also taste fit
and what they're doing is they're adding
obviously they're making them look
really fun to eat but they're doing you
a textural favor too so there you have
our lavender shortbread wreaths and you
can find the recipe at bone Appetit com
